programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Oklahoma, Florida, Arkansas, Florida State, Texas, Tennessee, South Carolina and Oregon are the hosts of each best-of-three matchup.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Oklahoma City jumped out to a 2-0 lead in the series with a 118-103 win over Minnesota in Game 2 behind 38 points and eight assists from recently-awarded MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, along with 26 points and 10 rebounds from Jalen Williams.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Oklahoma, Florida, Arkansas, Florida State, Texas, Tennessee, South Carolina and Oregon are the hosts of each best-of-three matchup.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Landon Knack (2-1, 6.17) is 0-1 with an 8.38 ERA in his last two starts after allowing four runs against Arizona; Kodai Senga (4-3, 1.43) allowed three earned runs or fewer in each of his nine starts after holding Boston to three runs on May 19.

programme.title: Women's College Lacrosse
programme.desc: No 3 seed Northwestern made it 11 straight with a 17-8 with a 12-11 win over Boston College; No. 1 seed North Carolina stayed undefeated after a 20-4 win over Florida, and beat the Wildcats, 15-12, on March 27 behind eight points from Chloe Humphrey.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Oklahoma, Florida, Arkansas, Florida State, Texas, Tennessee, South Carolina and Oregon are the hosts of each best-of-three matchup.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: SEC teams prepare for their upcoming opponent with practice sessions and work inside the film room, featuring coaches drilling their players and offering advice, an exclusive look at how the schools game plan, and exclusive talks with team members.

programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Oklahoma, Florida, Arkansas, Florida State, Texas, Tennessee, South Carolina and Oregon are the hosts of each best-of-three matchup.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: The winner of the matchup in Game 13 between top-seeded Georgia Tech and No. 5 seed Clemson faces the winner of Game 14 for an automatic berth in the NCAA Tournament; Duke is the defending champion, while Clemson leads all teams with 11 titles.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The New York Knicks, led by Walt Frazier, Earl Monroe, Willis Reed, Bill Bradley and Dave DeBusschere, would capture the imagination of New York City during a colorful and volatile era with their scrappy but dazzling style and amazing teamwork.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.sub-title: Winning Time: Reggie Miller vs The New York
programme.desc: In the 1995 NBA Eastern Conference semifinals Reggie Miller became known as "The Garden's Greatest Villain," when he continuously broke the hearts of the New York Knicks, while leading the Indiana Pacers and waging a war of words with New York fans.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: The winner of the matchup between No. 8 seed Tennessee and No. 4 seed Vanderbilt in Game 13 takes on the winner of Game 14 for an automatic berth in the NCAA Tournament; Tennessee is the defending champion, while LSU has won the title 12 times.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: South Carolina baseball coach Ray Tanner made it a point for the players to visit a children's hospital each season, as the players during the 2010 and 2011 national title seasons formed a bond with two special kids undergoing cancer treatment.

programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Oklahoma, Florida, Arkansas, Florida State, Texas, Tennessee, South Carolina and Oregon are the hosts of each best-of-three matchup.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In 1998, a year after the Chicago Bulls defeated Utah in the NBA Finals, their path to a sixth title only gets more challenging as it goes along, as a brutal seven-game series against the Indiana Pacers decides the Eastern Conference.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: An in-depth examination of a particular athlete or issue that has captured the attention of sports fanatics across the nation; coverage includes exclusive interviews, exhaustive reporting and extensive expert analysis regarding the subject.

programme.title: X Games
programme.desc: The world's best action sports athletes compete for X Games gold and prize money on the grandest stages around the world, as the participants put together the best trick or the best run in order to earn a spot on the podium and claim that gold medal.

programme.title: NCAA Baseball Selection Special
programme.desc: The 64-team field is selected, and 16 seeded teams will host four-team regionals in a double-elimination format; the 16 regional champions advance to the best-of-three Super Regionals, which will be staged at eight sites across the country.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The story of the 1985 Mississippi State Bulldogs team and how they failed to win the College World Series is retold, including the complicated relationship between Will Clark and Rafael Palmeiro and an exploration of what the players accomplished.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Four-time defending champion Max Verstappen secured his second win of the season with a victory at Emilia-Romagna, while Lando Norris cut his deficit to Oscar Piastri to 13 points; Charles Leclerc won at Monaco last year over Piastri.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The hosts do a top 10 countdown as they take an in-depth look at many of the greatest moments in the history of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, and examine the most brutal knockouts, stunning upsets and devastating brawls.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: With the help of Shaquille O'Neal and Penny Hardaway, the Orlando Magic franchise vaulted to the top of the NBA in the 90s and became a pop culture phenomenon, but as with all stories, the fairy tale came to an end when Shaq departed for the Lakers.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Pato O'Ward to 97 points after an Indianapolis Grand Prix win, his fourth of the season; Josef Newgarden won the last two Indianapolis 500s after beating O'Ward last year.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Paris Saint-Germain and Stade Reims played to 1-1 draws in both of their meetings from the 2024-25 league season, most recently matching up on Jan. 25; Reims Keito Nakamura found the net with the equalizer after Ousmane Dembl broke the deadlock.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: A new generation of drivers have their sights set to "The Greatest Spectacle in Racing," and putting their name amongst the greatest to compete in IndyCar, profiling some of the top up-and-coming drivers that have put their names in contention.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: A new generation of drivers have their sights set to "The Greatest Spectacle in Racing," and putting their name amongst the greatest to compete in IndyCar, profiling some of the top up-and-coming drivers that have put their names in contention.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the 109th Indianapolis 500; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Indianapolis 500: Pit Stop Contest
programme.desc: The pit crews from the drivers competing in the 109th Indianapolis 500 take part in the single elimination tournament, as the crews have to complete a standard pit stop of a four tire change and a refueling in the fastest time to win.

programme.title: IndyCar: Anything to Win
programme.desc: Interviews with drivers, legends and celebrities give an in-depth perspective at the magnitude of one of the most prestigious races, the Indianapolis 500, what the drivers are willing to risk for the checkered flag and the emotion of winning.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Tony Gonsolin (2-0, 4.05) gave up four runs in only four innings against the Angels on May 18; David Peterson (2-2, 2.86) allowed two or fewer runs in eight of his nine starts this season after holding the Yankees to two runs, one earned, on May 18.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Johann Zarco secured his first win since 2023 with his victory at France over six-time champion Marc Marquez, who moved into first over his brother, Alex, by 22 points; Enea Bastianini won the race at Silverstone last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Johann Zarco secured his first win since 2023 with his victory at France over six-time champion Marc Marquez, who moved into first over his brother, Alex, by 22 points; Enea Bastianini won the sprint race at Silverstone last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Johann Zarco secured his first win since 2023 with his victory at France over six-time champion Marc Marquez, who moved into first over his brother, Alex, by 22 points; Enea Bastianini won the race at Silverstone last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Pato O'Ward to 97 points after an Indianapolis Grand Prix win, his fourth of the season; Josef Newgarden won the last two Indianapolis 500s after beating O'Ward last year.

programme.title: IndyCar: Anything to Win
programme.desc: Interviews with drivers, legends and celebrities give an in-depth perspective at the magnitude of one of the most prestigious races, the Indianapolis 500, what the drivers are willing to risk for the checkered flag and the emotion of winning.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Pato O'Ward to 97 points after an Indianapolis Grand Prix win, his fourth of the season; Josef Newgarden won the last two Indianapolis 500s after beating O'Ward last year.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio (1-7) lost its last four games since beating DC, 24-21, on April 20; St. Louis (6-2) won four-straight games, and defeated the Brahmas, 26-9, on April 6 behind three rushing TDs from Jacob Saylors and 220 total yards from Manny Wilkins.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (6-2) won its last two games after a 33-30 win over Arlington behind 240 passing yards and two touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu; Houston (3-5) dropped its last two games since beating Memphis, 21-20, on May 3 behind Jalan McClendon.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The North American PBA Tour heads to Allen Park, Michigan for the 2025 PBA Playoffs Championship, consisting of four top-seeds and four play-in participants; David Krol claimed the 2024 edition of the tournament from the No. 9 seed.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Johann Zarco secured his first win since 2023 with his victory at France over six-time champion Marc Marquez, who moved into first over his brother, Alex, by 22 points; Enea Bastianini won the sprint race at Silverstone last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Pato O'Ward to 97 points after an Indianapolis Grand Prix win, his fourth of the season; Josef Newgarden won the last two Indianapolis 500s after beating O'Ward last year.

programme.title: Indianapolis 500 Victory Celebration
programme.desc: The Indianapolis 500 weekend ends with a banquet, recognizing all the drivers who competed in the 109th edition of the race, special awards are presented to select individuals and the winner of "The Greatest Spectacle in Racing" is honored.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: Multiple racing teams arrive at the Thermal desert for a shot at glory, but all eyes are on bitter rivals Team Penske and Chip Ganassi Racing, a longstanding feud that starts with a bang at the opening race in St. Petersburg.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Paris Saint-Germain and Stade Reims played to 1-1 draws in both of their meetings from the 2024-25 league season, most recently matching up on Jan. 25; Reims Keito Nakamura found the net with the equalizer after Ousmane Dembl broke the deadlock.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The North American PBA Tour heads to Allen Park, Michigan for the 2025 PBA Playoffs Championship, consisting of four top-seeds and four play-in participants; David Krol claimed the 2024 edition of the tournament from the No. 9 seed.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Cavalry claimed victories against Valour in two of their last three meetings, split by a draw, winning the final matchup on Oct. 19 with a 2-1 scoreline; Tobias Warschewski found the net with a brace for Cavalry to complete the comeback win.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Sydney (4-6-0) snapped a two-match losing streak to the Demons with an 86-64 victory in last season's Opening Round on March 7, 2024; Narrm (4-6-0) has won four of its last five contests after defeating Brisbane, 99-88, on May 18.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 2 seed UConn (38-20) advanced with an 11-2 win over No. 3 seed Xavier in Game 5, as the Huskies scored six runs in the fifth inning; top-seeded Creighton (40-14), which advanced with victories over defending champion St. John's and Xavier.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: York United claimed a 2-0 victory against Vanocuver in their first meeting of the season on April 6 with a brace scored by Julian Altobelli in the second half; goalkeeper Callum Irivng had 8 saves and played 10 long balls for Vancouver in the defeat.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: San Diego claimed a 2-0 victory against Los Angeles in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 23 through a brace scored by Anders Dreyer; Hirving Lozano and Toms ngel provided the assists for Dreyer's brace in the win away from home.

programme.title: 2025 Senior PGA Championship
programme.desc: The tournament was first held at Augusta National Golf Club in 1937 and is the oldest of the five major championships on the PGA Tour Champions; England's Richard Bland won last year's edition at The Golf Club at Harbor Shores in Benton Harbor, Mich.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: Davis Riley carded even-par 70 over the final round to finish atop the leaderboard at 14-under 266 and earned a paycheck for $1,638,000 and 500 FedExCup points with his five-stroke win over Scottie Scheffler and Keegan Bradley in last year's edition.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $9.5 million purse, debuted in 1946 and has been played at Colonial Country Club since its inception; Ben Hogan, who won the first two editions of the tournament (1946-47), owns the tournament record with five titles.

programme.title: ACE Shootout Celebrity Skills Challenge
programme.desc: Rivalries and hilarity are in full force at the 23rd annual event, which brings together teams of celebrities to compete in fun challanges at the famous Mauna Kea Golf Course to help raise funds and awareness for Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: Nacho Elvira of Spain finished at 18-under 266 and earned his first DP World Tour title since winning the 2021 Cazoo Open with his one-stroke triumph over Romain Langasque, Niklas Nrgaard and Thomas Pieters in last year's edition of the tournament.

programme.title: 2025 Senior PGA Championship
programme.desc: Richard Bland of England carded an 8-under 63 over the final round to finish at 17-under 267 for a three-stroke triumph over Australia's Richard Green in last year's edition held at The Golf Club at Harbor Shores in Benton Harbor, Mich.

programme.title: College Golf
